#Text=Alexander Gordon , 1st Earl of Huntly
#Text=Warning :
#Text=Page using Template : Infobox officeholder with unknown parameter " noble family " ( this message is shown only in preview ) .
#Text=Alexander Seton , 1st Earl of Huntly ( died 15 July 1470 ) , who adopted the family name of Gordon from about 1457 , was a powerful 15th-century Scottish magnate .
#Text=He was knighted in 1439/1440 and was Lord of Badenoch , Gordon , Strathbogie and Cluny .
#Text=Life

#Text=He was the son of Alexander Seton , Lord Gordon ( died 1440 ) ( 2nd son of Sir William Seton of that Ilk ) , by his spouse Elizabeth Gordon ( died 16 March 1439 ) , daughter and heiress of Sir Adam Gordon of that Ilk . [ 1 ]
#Text=In 1435 he accompanied the princess Margaret to France to marry the 9th Dauphin of France . [ 2 ]
#Text=In a charter dated 23 February 1439 – 40 , he is styled Sir Alexander Seton of Tullibody , heir of Elizabeth Gordon .

#Text=The charter confirmed an earlier exchange of lands between Sir William Keith and Margaret Fraser ( his maternal grandparents ) and William Lindsay , Lord of Byres exchanging lands for that of Dunottar . [ 3 ]
#Text=He succeeded his father as Lord Gordon before April 1441 . [ 2 ]

#Text=Alexander then resigned his lands to the king on 3 April 1441 and in return was granted a charter to himself and his wife Elizabeth of the lordships of Gordon , county Berwick ; Strathbogie , Aboyne , Glentanner and Glenmuick , in Aberdeenshire ; and Panbride in county Forfar ; to be held in liferent and by their son George Gordon in fee as well as his lawful male heirs . [ 4 ]
#Text=In 1449 , Alexander was raised to the peerage and created the first Earl of Huntly by King James II of Scotland , [ 5 ]
#Text=sometime before 3 July of that year when he witnessed a charter to James Hamilton , 1st Lord Hamilton under that title . [ 6 ]

#Text=Later in the year he was present at the gates of Arbroath Abbey when the Ogilvies and Lindsays were disputing their claims to the office of justiciary of that abbey ; where the Ogilvies were defeated and Earl Alexander , there in support of that family , had to flee the field himself . [ 6 ]
#Text=Tomb of Alexander Gordon , in Elgin Cathedral

#Text=He was embroiled in struggles against the Douglases , against the Lords of the Isles , and against the Lindsay earls of Crawford while being closely aligned with William Crichton , the Chancellor . [ 7 ]
#Text=On 28 April 1451 he received a charter from the king of the lordship of Badenoch and the castle of Ruthven . [ 8 ]
#Text=Gordon fought on the King 's side against the Douglases during The Douglas Rebellion and soundly defeated the Crawfords at the Battle of Brechin 18 May 1452 . [ 9 ]
#Text=Huntly adopted the family name of Gordon about 1457 . [ 10 ]
#Text=He died on 15 July 1470 at Huntly Castle [ 1 ] and was buried in Elgin Cathedral . [ 11 ]
#Text=Family
#Text=Alexander Gordon married first , c.8 January 1426 Egidia Hay , daughter and heir of John Hay of Tullibody . [ 12 ]
#Text=Together they had a son :
#Text=Alexander Seton , ancestor of the Setons of Touch , and Abercorn ; succeeded to his mother 's lands . [ 12 ]
#Text=He obtained an annulment to this marriage in 1438 in order to marry Elizabeth Crichton , daughter of William Crichton , the Chancellor of Scotland . [ lower-alpha 1 ] [ 11 ]
#Text=Alexander and Elizabeth had the following children :
#Text=George Gordon , 2nd Earl of Huntly , succeeded to the earldom and his father 's lordships [ 13 ]
#Text=Sir Alexander Gordon of Midmar , later of Abergeldie , married Beatrix Hay , daughter of William Hay , 1st Earl of Erroll [ 13 ]
#Text=Adam Gordon , Dean of Caithness [ 13 ]
#Text=William Gordon [ 13 ]
#Text=Margaret Gordon , before 9 November 1457 contracted to marry Nicholas Hay , 2nd Earl of Erroll but for some reason did not and he married her sister Elizabeth . [ 13 ]

#Text=Elizabeth Gordon ( died 17 Apr 1500 ) , married Nicholas Hay , 2nd Earl of Erroll , and then after his death she remarried , John Kennedy , 2nd Lord Kennedy , and had issue by her second husband [ 13 ]
#Text=Christian Gordon , married William Forbes , 3rd Lord Forbes , on 8 July 1468 , and had issue [ 13 ]
#Text=Lady Catherine Gordon , on 30 September 1461 she was contracted to marry Archibald ( then aged 12 ) , eldest son of George Douglas , 4th Earl of Angus but the marriage did not take place [ 14 ]

#Text=Alexander Gordon had two additional children by a daughter of Cumming of Altyre , identified by her byname ' the Fair Maid of Moray ' , but there is no record of a marriage between them . [ 14 ]
#Text=They were :
#Text=Janet ( died 1470 – 73 ) , married to James Innes of Innes [ 14 ]
#Text=Margaret ( died c.1506 ) , married in 1484 to Hew Rose , 6th Lord of Kilravock [ 14 ]
